Package org.lightningj.util

Class ZBase32

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lightningj.util.ZBase32
  • public class ZBase32
extends java.lang.Object
    Z-Base32 encoder/decoder utility class, implementing the specification from http://philzimmermann.com/docs/human-oriented-base-32-encoding.txt. Z-base32 is intended to be a more human friendly encoding than base32 and is used in Lightning in for instance invoicing. This code is very much influenced by the golang version in github project tv42/zbase32. Created by Philip Vendil on 2018-02-15.

        public static byte[] decode​(byte[] data,
                            int numberOfBits)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method the decode a byte[] z-base32 encoded array into the original bytes when the exact number of bits is known.
        Parameters:
        data - the z-base32 data to decode.
        numberOfBits - the number of bits to use in the input data.
        Returns:
        the original decode data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid z-base32 data was specificed.
